2.text: and today I'm going to see how well my Dad and Mark

14.text: I think Mark said the Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

18.text: I think Stephen said the Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

20.text: Both reveal at the same time

28.text: Favourite novel? Mark what do you think

34.text: That's tough. Is he going to go for a Sherlock Holmes novel?

36.text: I really don't know. I've never met Steven

38.text: We've never had any kind of exchange or views about anything

41.text: A novel? That really is tough that.

43.text: It should be The Thirty-Nine Steps. It won't be but

46.text: I'm going to say The Thirty-Nine Steps

49.text: I really don't know but I'm just going to randomly say

53.text: The Time Machine by H.G. Wells

57.text: Was it? Ah, do you know I was nearly going to guess

65.text: That was awful, I thought it was a movie

67.text: It is a movie and a novel!

69.text: What's the next question Louis Moffat?

72.text: Who was your hero growing up? What do you think Steven's is?

78.text: Ooh! What do you think his is?

84.text: You were technically, Tom Baker's right

89.text: Kind of. I just went for all of them.

94.text: No, I've got quite good at that.

98.text: Shopping. I'm going to say Mark's bad habit is shopping

107.text: Ah, close! Kinda close. Not bad actually.

117.text: That's become a thing now, it's a bit like not phoning home enough.

122.text: What piece of writing are you most proud of?

130.text: The Eleventh Hour, that was the trickiest script you've ever had to write

134.text: Oh I know! Yes, I'm going to say it's A Scandal In Belgravia

148.text: Some people might have spotted that

151.text: It's time for our musical break, Louis sing!

154.text: What's the next question Louis Moffat?

156.text: What is your favourite snack, Steven Moffat?

158.text: Okay. I know what you think it isn't and it's quite close.

164.text: If you don't get it then you don't know him.

171.text: I was gonna say crisps I was honestly going to say crisps!

174.text: That was a bit of a cheat

178.text: Close enough. Spicy tuna and crispy rice!

190.text: I remember it, we went to a screening separately...

200.text: This show could run and run!

202.text: Thank you for watching if indeed you did

204.text: and if you didn't well who cares about you

206.text: Well if they saw this they'd already have been watching

208.text: I know, that's my point. Please like our show.
